column3:
Hmm, I think this is only relevant if there is a limit on the max line length, so that clang-format goes on to break/wrap the line (#21223 adds such a limit). Otherwise with or without this PR the following line remains unchanged:

```cpp
    CNode* pnode = new CNode(id, nLocalServices, sock->Release(), addrConnect, CalculateKeyedNetGroup(addrConnect), nonce, addr_bind, pszDest ? pszDest : "

> I think this is only relevant if there is a limit on the max line length, so that clang-format goes on to break/wrap the line (#21223 adds such a limit). Otherwise with or without this PR the following line remains unchanged...\n\nWithout this change, clang-format will try to fix argument/parameter lists that are already bin packed into a single line.
review ACK 876ac3f6b62087fb5c22b0a477751895915d47b8\n\nLooks like this is making clang-format *less* restrictive. The new config allows single-line, one-per-line, and packed-lines.
